trans-unit.source: Represents the standard parameters for the elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) algorithm.

Represents the curve associated with the public key (<xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q"></xref>) and the optional private key (<xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.D"></xref>).
Represents the private key `D` for the elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) algorithm, stored in big-endian format.
Represents the public key `Q` for the elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) algorithm.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Validate%2A> method checks the integrity of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters> structure, throwing a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> when it is not valid.

<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q>.<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECPoint.X> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q>.<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECPoint.Y> are required fields and must have the same length.

If the curve is an explicit curve, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.D> is required and must have the same length as <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Curve>.<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve.Order>.

If the curve is a named curve, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.D> is required and must have the same length as <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q>.<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECPoint.X> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q>.<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECPoint.Y>.
The key or curve parameters are not valid for the current curve type.
